56 [Thomas ap.]
SEint Thomas þe guode Apo&slong;tle : Imartred was in .Inde
Of is lif we moten rede : ase we in boke dothþ finde
Þe ȝwyle o&rrot;e louerd on eo&rrot;þe was : with him he wende aboute
Men cleopeden him sethþe ane tonome : Thomas longue in doute :
Fo&rrot; þo o&rrot;e louerd fram deþe to liue aros : In doute þarof he was
Þe Apo&slong;tles it leueden echone wel : bote þis ilke seint Thomas
Bote he seide þat he it nolde ileue : bote he seiȝe is wounde
And handlede as and þerinne pulte : is finguer oþur is þombe[al. to þe grounde]
Fo&rrot; þis Misbileue men him cleopeden : Thomas longue in doute
Ase men redeth ȝeot in holie churche : ȝwan is dai cometh aboute
¶Sethþe cam o&rrot;e louerd cri&slong;t : mid is woundes al ablode
To him and to is desciples : þare huy togadere &slong;tode
Ore louerd seide Thomas hider þi finguer : ant pult here into mi side
And ne beo nouȝt in misbileue : fo&rrot; mine woundene þou sixt wide
Þo biliefde he wel þat it was soth : and also euereft mo&rrot;e
Mi louerd he seide and mi god God : ich bidde þe milce and o&rrot;e
Þo þat he þe soþe isaiȝ : o&rrot;e louerd he louede fa&slong;te
And p&rrot;echede is manhede and cri&slong;tinedom : þe ȝwile is lif ila&slong;te
¶It bifeol longue after þe tyme : þat o&rrot;e louerd to heouene wende
Þat Gondofre þe king of Inde : wel wide aboute sende
Ȝif man miȝhte ani Carpenter : finde quoynte and sleiȝh
In anie londe þat him couþe arere : a paleys noble and heiȝh
In þe londe of cesaree : seint Thomas was þo
ovre louerd aliȝhte adoun fram heouene : and aȝein him cam go
Thomas he seide þe king of Inde : haueth isent hereneiȝh
To furie[al. seche] after a Carpenter : þat were quointe and sleiȝh
Cum here with me and ichulle : þudere to him þe sende
A. louerd þin o&rrot;e quath seint Thomas : Ine rechche ȝwodere ich wiende
Bote þat Ine come nouȝt in Inde : fo&rrot; þarof me deth agrise
Siend me elles ȝwodere þou wolt : ac þudere in none wise
¶Þou schalt wiende þudere o&rrot;e louerd seide : and ichulle beon with þe
And ȝwane þou ha&slong;t þo&rrot;uȝh þi p&rrot;echingue : þat londfolc ib&rrot;ouȝht to me
Þou schalt þare imartred beon : and to me þanne iwiende
Go we to þis Messager : and þudere ichulle þe siende
huy come and metten þis Messager : þat b&rrot;ouȝte þis tyþingue
Ase he cam fur&slong;t op of þe se : amiddes þe Chepingue
Aben he was ihote. : o&rrot;e louerd hine þare mette
And axede ȝwat he þere souȝhte : and wel faire he him grette
¶Mi louerd Gondofre quath Aben : "þat is kyng of Inde
Sende me hidere ȝif þat ich miȝhte : ani quoynte Carpenter finde
And þat [ich] houso ich euere on toke : in alle manere him b&rrot;ouȝte
Þat [ich] with Catele ȝif he were þral : of is louerd him bouȝte
And þat ich him[om. him] ȝif he freo man were : huyrde him deo&rrot;e inouȝh
And fo&rrot;to do sumȝware mi neode : hiderward ich d&rrot;ouȝh
¶Ich habbe ane man o&rrot;e louerd seide : þat riȝht min owene is
Þat ȝwanne ich him ofte aboute sende : wel he wrouȝhte iwis
And dude is me&slong;ter swiþe wel : ȝwodere he euere iwende
And euere al þat he miȝhte biȝite[MS. ȝẹite] : he b&rrot;ouȝte me oþur sende
Fo&rrot; quoynto&rrot;e bold he can make : þane euere in Inde were
Ne swuch man nis þare in Inde non : þat swuch bold couþe arere."[al. 2 vv. mo&rrot;e.]
Ore louerd tok seint Thomas : Aben bi þe honde
Þat ope þe fo&rrot;ewarde þat he made : ladde him to is londe.[al. 2 vv. mo&rrot;e.]
¶Aben ope þis fo&rrot;ewarde : glad and bliþe was
Into schipe he wende anon : with þe guode man seint Thomas
Sone he axede seint Thomas : ase huy in þe se iwende
Ȝweþer he puyrliche is man were : þat him þudere sende
Ȝif ich nadde quath seint Thomas : puyrliche is man ibeo
Mi manhe[de][al. his manrede] ich wolde habbe fo&rrot;sake : þo he bitok me þe
Seiȝe þou me quath Aben ȝeot : ȝwat is þi seruise
Ȝwareof serue&slong;t þou þat heiȝe Man man : þat ȝe beon boþe so wise
¶A carpenter quath seint Thomas : "ich am quoynte and sleiȝh
paleys and bold ich can arere : swiþe noble and heiȝh
strong and liȝt and swiþe fair : withouten and withinne
Þat no man ne may it felle adoun : with &slong;trencþe ne with ginne
Ne so &slong;trong wynd ne tempe&slong;te : þat greuie mouwe it ouȝt
So quoynte bold nas neuere on eo&rrot;þe : to no p&rrot;ince iwrouȝt
Deu merci quath þis Aben : þat þi louerd gret Man man is
Þat so quoynte Men men hat onder him : inot non swuch iwis
¶Heiȝh Man man he is quath seint Thomas : and an heiȝ kyngues sone
Ope ane heiȝe Montayngne his wonijngue is : þare he wole euere wone
Þare he halt is heritage : and is fader kynedom an heiȝh
Þare nis non of is fon so &slong;trong : þat mouwe come þereneiȝh
Sik man ne pouere nis þare non : so riche þat lond is
So murie lond nas neuere iseiȝe : ne of swuch solas ne blis
Tellinde huy rouweden fo&rrot;th in þe se : so þat þo&rrot;uȝ guod winde
Þene seueþe day huy comen alond : wel a þeos half Inde
¶At ane heiȝe toune huy ariueden : þare a kyng inne lay
Þat liet weddi to an heiȝh Man man : his douȝhter þat ilke day
At þis b&rrot;uydale was plei inouȝh : song and gret hoppingue
Tabours and fiþele and symphanye : &slong;tiues and harpingue
Seint Thomas and þis Aben : wenden to þis fe&slong;te
So Manie Men men wel ofte doth : with liȝt biddingue oþur he&slong;te
¶A Tabo&rrot;ere song atþe mete : ase it is[al. om.; r. ire?] riȝhte was
Ase he eode singuynde op an doun : he biheold on seint Thomas
hire[MS. him] þouȝhte þat he was cri&slong;tine man : to paiȝen him he gan singue
Cri&slong;tine men habbez ane god God : louerd of alle þingue
Þo seint Thomas þis iheo&rrot;de : he bad hire singue eftsone
Þis tabo&rrot;ere song up an doun : and dude seint Thomas bone
Þe Botiler chidde with seint Thomas : fo&rrot; he made hire singue mo&rrot;e
And smot him a boffat onder þe Ere : þat him smert ful so&rrot;e
¶Inelle nouȝt arise quath seint Thomas : heonne fram mi fere
Are ich iseo an hound b&rrot;ingue þulke hond : among al þis folke here
Þo þat folk hadde alme&slong;t iȝete : þe Botiler wende sone
Out to ane welle to fechche in watur : ase he hadde þarewith to done
Þo he out to þe welle cam : a leon þere cam gon
Ant hente þene botiler bi þe þrote : and a&slong;tranglede him anon
And tod&rrot;ouȝh ech lime fram oþur. : an hound þere cam bi cas
And kipte up þe hond in is mouth : þat he smot with seint Thomas
And bar as in bifo&rrot;e al þat folk : and so bifo&rrot;e þe kingue
Þare nas non þat þis isaiȝh : þat ne wond&rrot;eden of þat þingue
And seiden þis is an holi Man man : þat god God deth fo&rrot;e swuch dede
Fo&rrot; bi þe botilere it is icome : riȝht ase he er seide
¶Þe kyng liet cleopie bifo&rrot;e him : seint Thomas anon
And seide þou art an holi man : þat þus awrecxt þe of þine fon
Þou schalt with me to mi douȝter : into hire chaumb&rrot;e wende
And blessi hire and hire spouse : þat huy habben þe bettere ende
Seint Thomas with þe king : into chaumb&rrot;e gan gon
Þat ȝongue wif and hire spouse : aȝein him come anon
Seint Thomas is holie hond : ope beiȝe heo&rrot;e heuedes leide
And blessede heom a godes Godes name : and is o&rrot;esun seide
¶he nam is leue and wende aȝein : and þe ȝongue spouse
ladde him fo&rrot;th & þonkede him : þat he cam in þe house.[This verse on the margin.]
A ȝeo&rrot;d of palm cam in is hond : he nu&slong;te hou it cam
Ase he ladde seint Thomas : wel gladliche he it nam
Þe ȝeo&rrot;d was ful of Dates : wexinde ase þei huy were
Gret wonder and ioye huy [hadden] : of þis miracle þere
Þis ȝounge Man man bar is ȝonge wif : þis fruyt so guod and suete
Of þat fruyt huy nomen boþe : and gladliche þarof ete
¶Sone þo huy hadden þarof iete : huy ne miȝhten no feo&rrot; gon
Ake ayþer lai adoun bi oþur : and softe slepen anon
Men beddeden heom ase softe ase huy miȝhten : and palles on heom ca&slong;te
And wenden alle out bote heomsuluen two : and þe do&rrot;en maden fa&slong;te
Ase huy leiȝe boþe and slepen : a fair king to heom cam
And bitwene heom &slong;tod in fair Abite : and bitweone is Armes heom nam
Mine leoue child&rrot;en he seide : min apo&slong;tle þat was her
Blessede eov fo&rrot; þat ȝe scholden : of heouene beo parteners
Dothþ aftur him and ȝe schullen beo : þare withouten ende
Stille he liet heom ligge and slepe : and wel softe aȝein gan wende
¶Þo huy awoken huy leiȝen and tolden : hou þat it beo miȝhte
gret wonder huy hadden fo&rrot; huy nu&slong;ten : nouȝht of þis noble siȝhte
Ase huy leiȝen and herof tolden : seint Thomas to hom[MS. him] wende
Þe kyng he seide "þat with eov spak : hidere to eov me sende
Þei ȝates and do&rrot;en beo fa&slong;te imade : he hath [me] in ib&rrot;ouȝt
Ȝif ȝe wollez þe Ioye afongue : þat he haueth to eov iwrouȝht
And his blessingue þat ich eov ȝaf : þo&rrot;uȝ me witez also
In Ioye and blisse withouten ende : of heouene he wole eov do
Fo&rrot; ȝe habbez ȝeot ouwer Maidenhod : þat of eche guodnesse is quene
Þat neuere ne adwynet bifo&rrot;e god God : ac euere is b&rrot;iȝt and schene
Þis ȝongues[al. ȝonge þinges] feollen adoun : to seint Thomas akneo
And crieden on him þat he heom teiȝte : in guode liue to beo
¶Seint Thomas heom p&rrot;echede anon : hou it of o&rrot;e louerd is
And b&rrot;ouȝte heom boþe to cri&slong;tindom : and þe kingue and alle his
On of his desciples sethþe he nam : þat het dyonis
div class="linewrap"> And made him mai&slong;ter of þat folk : þat huy ne wrouȝten amis
Þesne dyonis he made p&rrot;eo&slong;t : and ane churche he liet arere
Þat folk cam eche daye : and heo&rrot;[d]e[MS. heo&rrot;e] seruise þere
Þo þat lond was al ib&rrot;ouȝt : in guod &slong;tat inov
Seint Thomas is leue nam : and toward Inde him d&rrot;ov
¶Anon so Aben þat cam aftur him : to Inde miȝhte him b&rrot;ingue
with gret Ioye he ladde him fo&rrot;th : and b&rrot;ouȝte him bifo&rrot;e þe kingue
To a fair place þe kyng him ladde : and axede him on alle wise
Ȝif he couþe þere swuch bold arere : ase he him couþe deuise
Seint Thomas biheold þis noble place : sire he seide ȝe
So fair bold nis in al þis lond : ase ich can here arere þe
Ane perche he nam and mat aboute : hou[al. as] ech hous scholde beo
¶Sire he seide mi deuis : þou schalt here iseo
Þe halle ichulle fur&slong;t arere : in þis place in alle wise
E&slong;tward þe do&rrot;e and þe p&rrot;oche : riȝht ase þe sonne arisez
Þat þe sonne ȝwane heo ari&slong;t : atþe do&rrot;e in schine
here ȝond ichulle þe chaumb&rrot;es habbe :[A v. om. : : ymete by myne lyne Here ȝond ichulle þe kuchen habbe :] And a conduyt þarebiside
he deuisede [al] euene inov : and longue inouȝ and wide
So noble bold ne miȝhte non beo : ase he gan þare deuise
¶Þe kyng of is sotilte : bigan sumdel agrise
And seide certus ich ȝiue þe p&rrot;is : of þe be&slong;te Carpenter
And þe quoynte&slong;te þat ich euere iknev : and be&slong;t deuised[al. deuise&slong;t] her
he toc him catel[al. gareisoun] inovȝ : swuch bold with to rere
And wende himsulf out of þe lond : þat to ȝer ne cam he þere
Seint Thomas þis treso&rrot; nam : and wide wende in londe
And p&rrot;echede Men men of cri&slong;tindom : and of god God to vnder&slong;tonde
Þat treso&rrot; he delde pouere men : euere ȝware he heom founde
¶Muche folk he b&rrot;ouȝte to cri&slong;tindom : aboute into al þat londe
¶Churchene he arerde mani on : and p&rrot;eo&slong;tes he sette þere
Swich quoynte bold and noble it was : þat he wolde þe kyngue arere
Þe þridde ȝer þe king cam hom : and wende alȝare to finde
his bold ase he hadde bispeke. : and þo was it al bihinde
After seint Thomas he sende anon : þat bitraide him so he seide
Sone Men men tolden him hou it was : and al of is dede
Þe king liet him nimen anon : and in &slong;trongue p&rrot;isone him do[A v. om.: & Aban þat him þuder b&rrot;oȝte : bi him he dude also]
And swo&rrot; othþ þat he scholde : al quik ihuld beo
And sethþe ibarnd alto dou&slong;te : and with þe wind awei fleo
¶Þe kingus b&rrot;oþer þat heiȝte Gad : al atþe deþe lay
Þe kyng al fo&rrot;ȝat seint Thomas : fo&rrot; deol þat he isaiȝh
he hiet is Men men witen him wel : and is felawe also
Fo&rrot;to is b&rrot;oþur were in betere point : þat he miȝhte heo&rrot;e dom heom do
¶So þat is b&rrot;oþur deide sone. : þe kyng made deol Inovȝh
he liet him agreiþi swiþe fayre : and elles it were wouȝh
Four dawes he heold him inne : þat he faire agreyþed were
In pourp&rrot;e and cheisel and guode ȝimmes : þat no defaute þare nere
Þo he [was][om.] imaud[al. agreiþed] with grete nobleye : þene feo&rrot;þe day huy him nome
And with gret compaygnie of heiȝe men : to is burijngue come
¶Ase huy wolden þis dede man : in is putte do
With grete nobleiȝe and p&rrot;uyte inov : and with wop and so&rrot; also
he aros up fram deþe to liue : among heom euerechone
Þo mauden huy Ioye and blisse inovȝ : þat lu&slong;ten er betere grone
Broþer he seide þo he aros : þou dude&slong;t ane vuele dede
Þat seint Thomas þe holie man : into p&rrot;isone liete lede
Fo&rrot; mid god God of heouene he is wel : and þo&rrot;uȝh him ich am nov
To liue ib&rrot;ouȝt ase ȝe iseothþ : and ichulle ȝou tellen hov
¶Fo&rrot; Aungles comen þo ich was ded : and mine soule bere
And scheuwede me þe Ioye of heouene : þei ich vnwuyrþe were
Þis noble bold he schewede me[al. me ek] : þat seint Thomas liet arere
with þat treso&rrot; þat þou him toke : god God ȝeue þat ich were þere
Imaud it is ase he deuisede þe : and noblelokur ȝif it may
Of ȝimmes and &slong;tones p&rrot;eciouse : so noble neuere ine saiȝ
Lo seide þe Aungel þo : sixt þou þis noble bold
Þis hath seint Thomas arerd : of þat seluer and of þat gold
Þat þi b&rrot;oþur him bitok : ellesȝware to biguynne
Ake þi b&rrot;oþur vnwuyrþe is : fo&rrot;to come þareinne
Ore louerd it ȝeue ich seide þo : þat it ouwere wille it were
þat ich mo&slong;te here po&rrot;ter beo : fo&rrot; non betere wuyrþe ich nere
¶we schullen seide an Aungel þo : to o&rrot;e louerd fo&rrot; þe biseche
Þat þi soule wende to eo&rrot;þe aȝein : þi lijf fo&rrot;to eche
Fo&rrot;to libben on eo&rrot;þe mo&rrot;e : to don al þine wille
Ake buye out Thomas of p&rrot;isone : ich rede þat he ne aspille
Þo he hadde þis tale itold : he o&rrot;n to seint Thomas
And feol to is fiet and þonkede him : ase he in p&rrot;isone was
And tolde al of him hou it was : and bad him ȝeo&rrot;ne also
To fo&rrot;ȝiue is b&rrot;oþur þe king : þat he him hadde misdo
¶Þe kyng cam also eo&rrot;ne anon : and criede him milce and o&rrot;e
To fo&rrot;ȝiuen him þat he hadde misdo : and seide he nolde nonmo&rrot;e
Out of p&rrot;isone huy b&rrot;ouȝten him sone : with Ioye and blisse inouȝ
Þat folk honourede him ase a god : and wel þicke aboute him d&rrot;ouȝ
Muche hath o&rrot;e louerd quath seint Thomas : fo&rrot; eov alle ido
Þat schewede eov þus is p&rrot;iuete : ȝwane ȝe ne beoth nouȝt wuyrþe þerto
Þat paleis is noble and riche inov : þat ich þare habbe iwrouȝt
with þet treso&rrot; þat þe king me tok : to ende it is ib&rrot;ouȝt
Ech man þat wole don aftur me : þudere he schal wende
And louerd and p&rrot;ince þare beo : euere withouten ende
Ȝe mouwe wienden into al þat lond : and iseon alaboute
Ech contreie ful of churchene : þarof ȝe mowen beo p&rrot;oute
Sire king alle huy beoth arerd : of tresur þat þou me toke
Ȝif þou nelt nouȝt ileue me : wiend aboute and loke
Þe kyng and al þat oþur folk : þat þicke aboute him com
Bilieueden on god God fo&rrot; þis miracle : and turnden to cri&slong;tindom
¶Fourtene þousend of men : to o&rrot;e louerd tur[n]den þere
withoute child&rrot;en and wummen : þat Manie also were
Seint Thomas heom teiȝhte þe riȝhte bileue : and made heom þarof wise
At eche churche he sette ane p&rrot;eo&slong;t : to don heom heo&rrot;e seruise
Þo huy weren alle in guod point : his leue wel faire he nam
And wende ferro&rrot;e into þe lond : to p&rrot;echi cri&slong;tindom
¶Into an oþur contreie he cam : þare he a&slong;tunte ane &slong;tounde
he pulte him fo&rrot;th wel baldeliche : and p&rrot;echede to grounde
Deue and blinde and oþere also : þat in sicknesse weren ibounde
he helde anon þo&rrot;uȝ godes Godes grace : ȝwane he anie founde
Swuche Miracle miracle ase he dude : þo&rrot;uȝ o&rrot;e louerdes sonde
Nas neuere among heom iseiȝe : in none &slong;tude of þe londe
¶Þat wo&rrot;d sp&rrot;ong of him wide : fale Io&rrot;neis þanne
Þat god God was into Inde icome : in a fourme of manne
he was gladdo&rrot;e þane ani Man man : þat þudere miȝhte wende
To habbe enes a siȝth of him : aboute in eche ende
Gret p&rrot;ece cam abouten him : of þe contreie feo&rrot; and neiȝh
And heolden him god God in Mannes fourme : euerech þat him iseiȝh
¶Þe riche men þat weren neiȝh : ane noble croune wrouȝten
Of gold and of Riche ȝymmes : and to þis holie Man man huy[al. om.] b&rrot;ouȝten
And echmanere cloþingue also : þat a kyng werie scholde
Fo&rrot;to cloþi him ase an heiȝh kyng : and crouni him with golde.[A v. om.: Grete tresour hi b&rrot;oȝte him ek : ȝif he it fonge wolde.]
¶Seint Thomas &slong;tod and biheold : noþing þarof he nolde
Mine leoue freond he seide ȝe weneth : þat ich beo þat inam nouȝt
Inam no kyng swuch þing to habbe : ase ȝe me habbuth iwrouȝt
Inam nouȝht god God ase some weneth : ake ich am is hine
And he me hath hidere isent : to b&rrot;ingue eou fram helle pine
And techen eov fursake eower false godes Godes : þat ne mouwen eov helpe nouȝt
And to bileue on o&rrot;e riȝhte louerd : þat us alle hath iwrouȝt
¶Bileueth on him ich eov rede : and to Ioye ȝe schullen wende
Þat tresour þat ȝe b&rrot;ingueth me : pouere men ȝe it sende
Fo&rrot; riȝht nouȝht inelle þareof : ake deleth it heom aboute
And bilieuez on Ihesu cri&slong;t : and noþing ne schulle ȝe doute."[v. 2667 al. om.]
Sike men þare comen þicke : aboute in euerech side
Blinde and Doumbe and oþere also : heo&rrot;e hele fo&rrot;tabide
Museles and crokede ek : and þat weren in palasye;[v. 2701 al. om.]
Ful þicke huy &slong;toden in þe place : on þis holie man to crie
¶Seint Thomas alle þeos sike Men men : b&rrot;ouȝhte in one place
And among heom sat adoun akneo : and bad o&rrot;e louerdes grace
Þat he cudde is miȝhte and is grace : and heo&rrot;e hele heom sende þere
So þat al þat folk þe soþe iseiȝe : þat almiȝhti god God he were
Þo he hadde o&rrot;e louerd þus ibede : among heom þare cam
So gret liȝht and cler schinyngue : þat heo&rrot;e siȝht heom alme&slong;t bi|nam
¶hit ouersp&rrot;adde fur&slong;t seint Thomas : ase he lai in is beden
And þe sike Men men alle þat huy fullen adoun : euerech in his &slong;tede
And leiȝen þare al plat to grounde : þe mountaunce of half a tide
Þe ȝwile þis grete liȝht ila&slong;te : ech bi oþeres side
Anon so þat liȝht ipassed was : þat ech miȝhte oþur iseo
Echone huy arisen up hole and sounde : holo&rrot;e ne miȝhte none men beo
¶Þare was Ioye and blisse inouȝ : þere ne miȝhte beo non mo&rrot;e
huy honoureden seint Thomas : and criden him milce and o&rrot;e
Þare turnden þo neiȝh a þousend men : and ibaptizede were
withoute child&rrot;en and wummen : þo&rrot;uȝ is miracle þere
Þat cri was þo þarof so muche : þat al þat lond wel wide
Þarof spac and þudere o&rrot;nen : ful þicke in euerech side
¶Carik hiet þe kingues mei : þat of þulke londe was
Migdonia heiȝte is wif : þat o&rrot;e louerd ȝaf swiþe fair cas
Fo&rrot; Migdonia þis guode wif : to a wumman cam
Þat heo knevȝ ero&rrot;e and was þo : iturnd to cri&slong;tindom
Þat hadde six ȝer blynd ibeo : and guod siȝht heo hadde þo
Leoue so&slong;ter quath þis Migdonie : hou is þis igo
Þat þov ha&slong;t so longue blind ibeo : and nou art iheld so
Ȝwat is þilke wise Man man : þat swuch miȝhte may do
¶Certes Dame þis oþur seide : þe noble&slong;te Man man it is
Þat euere on vrþe amon[g] men cam : withoute god God sulf iwis
Fo&rrot; he heleth þe sike þat wollez beon hole : and þarof ne faillez he neuere
hadde&slong;tþov enes him iseiȝe : þe gladdo&rrot;e þou wolde&slong;t beo euere
Dev merci quath þis guode wijf : hou may ich be&slong;t[al. om.] on take
Þat ich hadde[al. nadde] iseiȝe þis holie man : þat swuch wonder may make
¶Wel þou schalt do þis oþur seide : fo&rrot; tomo&rrot;ewe ase he me tolde
he wole come and p&rrot;echi al þat folk : hov huy schullen heo&rrot;e bileue holde
Þou schalt with me þudere go : wel p&rrot;iueliche ich rede
And huyd þi face with[al. þi face ihud & in] oþur cloþus : þat no man ne wite þi dede
Þat guode wijf ne furȝat nouȝt þis : ake dude ase he ire radde
Chaungede hire cloþus and hudde ire face : and wende ase heo ire ladde
¶To þis holie p&rrot;echingue heo cam : þat no man ne knev hire þere
And iheo&rrot;de þane holie man : hov he gan þat folk lere
Þe grete miracles heo isaiȝh also : þat o&rrot;e louerd fo&rrot; him wrouȝhte
heo nu&slong;te ȝwat heo miȝhte fo&rrot; Ioye do : ake &slong;tod in grete þouȝhte
heo wilnede mo&rrot;e þanne aniþing : to speke with him a þrowe
Ake heo ne do&rrot;&slong;te fo&rrot; noþing : la&slong;te heo were iknowe
¶heo wende hom al ihud : ake euere heo hadde in þouȝhte
Anoþer time with him to speke : ȝwane o&rrot;e louerd þe time b&rrot;ouȝte
Bifo&rrot;e hire bedde heo lay anyȝht : and on o&rrot;e louerd criede longue
Þat heo mo&slong;te þo&rrot;uȝ seint Thomas : cri&slong;tindom afongue
¶Atþe mid niȝht seint Thomas cam : and bi hire &slong;tod atþe la&slong;te
Nu&slong;te heo neuere ȝware he cam In : þe do&rrot;en weren alle fa&slong;te
Beo glad he seide Migdonie : god God hath iheo&rrot;d þine bone
Þou ha&slong;t muche iwilned after me : ich come to þe here ful sone
God wole þat þou beo on of his : and þat þou come þo&rrot;uȝ me
To þe lif þat euere schal ila&slong;te : and þat ich beo aslawe fo&rrot; þe
Fo&rrot; þe ich schal imartred beo : and boþe we schullen wiende
To þe Ioye of heuene and þare beo : togadere withouten ende
¶Seint Thomas ȝaf hire cri&slong;tindom : are he þannes wende
And teiȝte hire al godes Godes lawe : hire lif fo&rrot;to amende
Þis wif bicam a guod womman : and nolde neuereft mo
After þat tyme fo&rrot; noþing : to hire louerdes bedde go
hire louerd was þarof so&rrot;e anuyd : and þo he ne miȝhte fo&rrot; no þingue
Maken hire enes neiȝh him come : he playnede him to þe kingue
¶Þe kyng hiet þe Quiene anon : þat he[= heo] scholde to hire wiende
And reden hire to honouri hire louerd bet : and don ase þe hende
Fo&rrot; wummen conne of oþeres rede : þarefo&rrot;e þe Quiene he sende
Þe Quiene adai wel mildeliche : to þis guode wumman wende
And radde hire to hire louerd go : to schilden hire fram vilenie
And noþing ne lieue þane false man : þat radde hire to schuche folie
¶A dame merci quath þis oþur : þou no&slong;t nouȝt hou it is
Ȝif þou wu&slong;te&slong;t al þat ich wot : þou nolde&slong;t nouȝt so segge iwis
Fo&rrot; so noble a man ase he is : nas neuere on eo&rrot;þe ido
hadde&slong;tþou him enes iseiȝe : þou wolde&slong;t segge also
And ȝif þou iseiȝe nouþe þat ich seo : þe wolde wond&rrot;i iwis
Fo&rrot; sympho&rrot; þe heiȝe knyȝt : þat Mai&slong;ter of knyȝhtes is
¶Todai was his sone ded : and sympho&rrot; wel ȝeo&rrot;ne him souȝte
Þane holie Man man seint Thomas : and to is sone nouþe him b&rrot;ouȝte
And þare he hath him riȝht nouþe : [arerd] fram deþe to liue
And þare he sit nouþe in is hous : and p&rrot;echez þat folk bliue
Aboute him also sike men : wel þicke comez nov gon
Crokede and blinde and oþure also : and [he] heom heleth echon
¶Leoue so&slong;ter quath þis Quiene : ȝweþur þis mouwe soth beo
Ȝe Dame certes quath þis oþur : and ȝif þou it wolt iseo
Go we þudere and þou schalt : þe soþe finde anon
Þe Quiene þouȝte þo ful longue : are heo were þudere igon
huy come and founden seint Thomas : riȝht ase þis womman seide
Þe Quiene &slong;tod and him biheold : and alle is holie dede
¶To is fiet heo ful adoun : heo ne miȝhte no leng abide
And bad him ȝiuen hire cri&slong;tindom : and merci fa&slong;te him cride
Sone þo heo icri&slong;tned was : hamward þane wei heo nam
To þe kyngue and longue hire þouȝte : are heo to him cam
Sire heo seide ich habbe ifounde : þis guode wijf Migdonie[r. þarefo&rrot;e; al. so þat]
In grete wisdome and ich wende er : to finde hire in folie
And gode Gode þonk of hire wisdom : heo partede with me
And þare[r. þarefo&rrot;e; al. so þat] inelle in þine folie : nonmo&rrot;e siwe þe
Þo was þe kyng so&rrot;i inovȝ : he nu&slong;te ȝwat þarof to do
Fo&rrot;to quelle is wif þarefo&rrot;e : none heo&rrot;te he nadde þarto
¶He cleopede Carik is cosyn : we beoth bitraide he seide
Mine Quiene ich sende ase þou wel wo&slong;t : þi wif fo&rrot;to rede
To b&rrot;ingue hire out of fole þouȝt : ase þou me fo&rrot; loue bede
And nouþe ich habbe hire fo&rrot;lo&rrot;e : fo&rrot;th with hire ich d&rrot;ede
Fo&rrot; loue of þe one ilo&rrot;e boþe : alas þe wrechhede
we moten us awreken of þat þeof : þat b&rrot;ingueth heom in swuch dede
¶He liet sienden aftur seint Thomas : ȝif Men men him miȝhten finde
And þo þis holie Man man ifounde was : fa&slong;te men him guonne binde
And harli him fo&rrot;th bifo&rrot;e þe kyng : his hondene him bihinde
So þat he was to deþe ib&rrot;ouȝt : in þe londe of Inde
Fo&rrot; þo he was bifo&rrot;e þe kyngue ib&rrot;ouȝt : þe kyng him hiet anon
Fo&rrot;to honouri heo&rrot;e false godes Godes : þat weren of treo and &slong;ton[a v. om.]
Oþur he wolde laten him to&rrot;menti : and tod&rrot;awe is flechs fram þe bon
¶Þis holie Man man fo&rrot;sok þo : is he&slong;te fo&rrot;to do
Irene plates he liet nime : b&rrot;ode and longue also
And liet heom ca&slong;te amidde þe fuyre : þat al glowinde huy weren anon
And sethþe he hiet þane holie Man man : þaruppe barefot gon
Anon so þis holie Man man
: sette is fet þareon
A welle with watur þare sp&rrot;ong out of þe vrþe : so cold so ani &slong;ton[al. out : of þe harde &slong;ton]
And aqueinte þat fuyr anon : þat so hot and &slong;trong was
Þe guode man eode fo&rrot;th þaron : þat neuere þe wo&rrot;se him nas
¶Þo was þe king neiȝh out of witte : an Ouene he liet hete
Þat heo was al glowinde fuyr : are huy wolden lete
Þene holie Man man huy nomen anon : and amidde þe Ouene him ca&slong;te
And þo he was þareinne ido : þat fuyr no leng ne la&slong;te
Ake it bigan to quienche anon : þat so gret hete er of d&rrot;ovȝ
Þe holie Man man þareinne was : in Ioye and Muruþe inovȝ
¶Þo þe kyng þis isaiȝh : he nu&slong;te hou on take
Carik he seide hou geth þis : o&rrot;e godus Godus us habbuth fo&rrot;sake
we ne mowen nouȝt þis luþere þeof : with none þingue quelle
Certus sire quath Car[i]k : anoþur ichulle þe telle
we schullen nime þis [luþere][om.]
Man man : and [to] o&rrot;e godes Godes him lede
And maken him fo&rrot;to honouri heom : mid eiȝe and fo&rrot; d&rrot;ede
Þo&rrot;uȝh ȝwan he schal is louerdes wrathþe : habben out and out
And is merueile him beo binome : þo&rrot;uȝ ȝwan he is so p&rrot;out
¶To þis Maumates þis holie man : ib&rrot;ouȝt was wel sone
Mid &slong;trencþe fo&rrot;to honouri heom : ase huy weren iwoned to done
Seint Thomas biheold þis maumates : ase he bifo&rrot;e heom &slong;tod
Ich coniouri eov he seide "in his name : þat fo&rrot; us schedde is blod
Ov deuelene þat þareinne beoth : and with foles wolleth speke
Þat ȝe sone þarof out fleon : and þe Maumates tob&rrot;eke
¶Anon so he hadde þis wo&rrot;d iseid : þe maumates ne miȝhte no leng duyre
Ake bigunnen al to melte awei : ase wex deth aȝein þe fuyre
Þat huy weren so alle to nauȝht ib&rrot;ouȝht : riȝht ase huy neuere nere
In gret wonder &slong;tod al þat folk : þat in þat paleis[al. place] were
Echone huy gonne with one mouþe : wel loude grede and crie
O. god God is almiȝhti one : ibo&rrot;en of Mayde Marie
Of ȝwam seint [Thomas] hath ispeke : to him we wollez alle us take
And þeos wrechches false godes Godes : clanliche alle fo&rrot;sake
¶Þo þe kyng and Carik : and þe false p&rrot;eo&slong;tes also
Þat wu&slong;ten þe Maumates iheo&rrot;den þis : huy nu&slong;ten ȝwat to do
Þe kyng and Carick fo&rrot; fyn wo : out of þe place wenden
Þo huy iseiȝen hou þis holie Man man : heo&rrot;e godus Godus so foule schende
huy ne do&rrot;&slong;ten fo&rrot; cri&slong;tine Men men : setten on him non hond
Ne also fo&rrot; þe grete Miracle miracle : þat Man man alday with him fond
¶Ake þe p&rrot;eo&slong;tes of þe false lawe : in grete wrathþe huy &slong;tode
Þat on hente in is hond a &slong;trong swerd : with ful wroþe mode
Of þis þeof ichulle he seide : mine godes Godes anon awreke
Þat heom hath swuch schame ido : hoso it euere bispeke
he leide on þis holi Man man : with is swerd to grounde
Into al is bodi and made him sone : manie eouele woundes
And amartrede so þane holie Man man : and aslouȝh him in a &slong;tounde
Þe cri&slong;tine Men men weren wroþe inouȝh : þo huy hine ded founden
Þane p&rrot;eo&slong;t huy wolden habbe ibarnd : ake he fleuȝh anon
And þe king and carik habbe aslawe : ake huy weren awei igon
¶Þis holie bodi huy nomen anon : and to churche it bere
And bureden it with gret honour : and with grete nobleye þere
So þat &slong;trencþe of holie churche : wexinde euere was
Þus cam into Inde cri&slong;tindom : fo&rrot;me&slong;t þo&rrot;uȝh seint Thomas
Nov seint Thomas þat Cri&slong;tindam : fo&rrot;me&slong;t into Inde b&rrot;ouȝte
B[r]ingue us to þe Ioye of heouene : to ȝwan o&rrot;e louerd us bouȝte
